title: No Email Checking at Invitation Confirmation Link leads to Account Takeover without User Interaction at CrowdSignal
content:
Summary:
<image_0>
Steps To Reproduce:
Go to https://app.crowdsignal.com/users/list-users.php with your team account
Invite an existing email (write victim's email)
And click to confirmation link with your account
You will log-in to victim's account directly
PoC video :
Impact
Account Takeover without user interaction

steps: Go to https://app.crowdsignal.com/users/list-users.php with your team account
Invite an existing email (write victim's email)
Click to confirmation link with your account
You will log-in to victim's account directly
vuln_description: The vulnerability allows an attacker to take over a victim's account by simply clicking on the confirmation link of an invitation sent to the victim's email, without any interaction from the victim. This bypasses the usual email verification step, leading to an account takeover.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward process of inviting an existing user and clicking a confirmation link, without requiring complex interactions or understanding of subtle application behaviors. The flaw is in the lack of proper email verification before account access is granted.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves an authenticated user (attacker) performing an action (inviting an existing email) and accessing a resource (victim's account) without proper authorization. This fits the IDOR vulnerability class where the attacker's session is used to perform an action that should require the victim's authorization. The methodology would detect this by swapping the attacker's session with the victim's session and observing the unauthorized access.
